p: Next, we found that AGPAT1-depletion increased DENV gRNA (p-value = 0.0004) and titer (p-value < 0.0001) at 7 dpi in whole mosquito ( Fig 4C and 4D), confirming that AGPAT1 depletion induces a pro-viral environment in vivo. However, the pro-viral impact of AGPAT1 depletion was not observed on infection rate ( S11A Fig) and at 2 dpi on gRNA ( S11B Fig). We repeated the experiment using a lower inoculum for oral infection and similarly observed no effect at 2 dpi but a moderate increase of gRNA (p = 0.0421) at 7 dpi ( S11Câ€“S11E Fig). It is intriguing that AGPAT1 depletion only increased infection at 7 dpi. This may indicate that DENV infection is necessary to amplify AGPAT1-mediated alteration in establishing a pro-viral environment. To characterize the AGPAT1-induced proviral environment, we compared the lipidome of infected mosquitoes that were AGPAT1 depleted or not. AGPAT1-depletion increased aminoPL concentrations at 7 dpi ( Fig 4E; S9 Table). Specifically, one PC, four PEs and one glycerophosphoethanolamine were upregulated. By artificially modulating the metabolome, we revealed that AGPAT1 depletion favors DENV by increasing aminoPL concentrations.
